intro: Seriphidium nitrosum, commonly known as the nitrous wormwood, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Seriphidium nitrosum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
